title: Sopa de Fideos Recipe
description: This recipe for sopa de fideos (tomato soup with crispy pasta) is simple and easy to make at home. Tastes just like the one at Mexican restaurants.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Noodle Soup Recipes Sopa de Fideos 4.4 (70) 57 Reviews 27 Photos This sopa de fideos recipe is my version of the tomato noodle soup they give you in Mexican restaurants before the meal. This can easily be made at home with just a few simple ingredients. Submitted by amandascookin Updated on November 19, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 27 27 27 27 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes 1 small onion, chopped 1 large clove garlic, coarsely chopped 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 (7 ounce) package fideo pasta, uncooked 3 (14.5 ounce) cans chicken broth coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro Directions Place tomatoes, onion, and garlic into a blender; pulse several times to get the mixture moving, then blend until smooth, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-low heat; stir in fideo pasta. Fry pasta gently, stirring often, until golden brown, 2 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour tomato mixture into a large saucepan; stir in chicken broth and noodles. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until noodles are tender, 7 to 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper; stir in cilantro and cook until warmed through. Recipe Tip You can substitute fideo with angel hair pasta, broken into small pieces. I Made It Print 200 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Sopa de Fideos 01 of 27 Photo by  Anthony Ramos 02 of 27 Photo by  LimeOil1656 05/06/2024 Omg my my this is a very good dish! But why did we have to put the pasta in the skillet? I also added jalapeños peppers and a little red pepper flakes also some ground beef ..This is like Spaghetti Tex mex without the beans or cheese! Delish! 03 of 27 Photo by  RedTuna6981 01/14/2024 This turned out fantastic, very easy to make and has become my favorite college meal! 04 of 27 Photo by  jakey 03/12/2021 05 of 27 Photo by  Deirdre Megan Sullivan 04/15/2020 06 of 27 Photo by  Lara White 03/30/2020 Delicious! Added a couple more cloves of garlic, used cheap broth in a cardboard box, cheap canned Whole tomatoes And this was soooooo good and touched my little Mexican soul 07 of 27 Photo by  Julia H 11/10/2019 08 of 27 Photo by  Kim Kavanaugh-Ortiz 11/01/2019 Yes, will make again. It was great to have after a long cold day in Chicago. So easy to make. I think I might add a cup more of chicken broth. Next time I might use beef broth too. 09 of 27 Photo by  Shaunda Tobias 09/10/2019 I like to keep the veggies chunky and double the cilantro because (I love cilantro ) I also add I chicken bouillon cube you dont really need to add the salt if you use the broth and the boullion cube . This is how I was taught to make it by my very mexican MIL and abuela 10 of 27 Photo by  Amanda Soto 06/12/2019 I added plenty of salt and pepper!! I also included Monterey Jack cubes, avocado and lime juice! Tasty!! Next time I’ll be more adventurous and add more ingredients! 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Vegan Borscht 21 Ratings Vermicelli Soup 11 Ratings Lemon Soup 56 Ratings Pasta Fagioli Soup with Bacon 198 Ratings Pasta with Lentil Soup Sauce 17 Ratings Asian Chicken and Corn Soup 1 Rating Bay Leaf Beet Soup 15 Ratings Savory Pumpkin Hummus 51 Ratings Mexican Cucumber Salad 181 Ratings Pota Brata (Irish Flag Soup) 5 Ratings Cucumber, Mango, and Black Bean Salad 6 Ratings Vegetarian Potato-Leek Soup 114 Ratings Kale Soup 676 Ratings Black Bean and Chickpea Chili 74 Ratings Cara's Moroccan Stew 91 Ratings Chestnut, Lentils and Vegetable Stew 16 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: amandascookin
instructions: Place tomatoes, onion, and garlic into a blender; pulse several times to get the mixture moving, then blend until smooth, 30 seconds to 1 minute.;Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-low heat; stir in fideo pasta. Fry pasta gently, stirring often, until golden brown, 2 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat.;Pour tomato mixture into a large saucepan; stir in chicken broth and noodles. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until noodles are tender, 7 to 8 minutes.;Season with salt and pepper; stir in cilantro and cook until warmed through.
